text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Feeding zone" means the immediate area, not to exceed approximately 600 square yards, in which feed for wild waterfowl is placed.

section.section: "Licensed area" means the property controlled by the applicant or applicants upon which the feeding of wild waterfowl is planned and licensed by the Department.

"Licensed area" includes those adjoining waters:
On which the licensee has the lawful right to hunt wild waterfowl; and
Where the licensee has obtained a licensed feeding zone or hunting blind or stand or both.

text.section: "Shooting blind" or "shooting stand" means the area, not to exceed approximately 80 square feet, from which the hunters are attempting to take wild waterfowl.
